How to Install libpdal-plugin-icebridge on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • libpdal-plugin-icebridge

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install libpdal-plugin-icebridge on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing libpdal-plugin-icebridge on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall libpdal-plugin-icebridge in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install libpdal-plugin-icebridge, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install libpdal-plugin-icebridge Using apt

To install libpdal-plugin-icebridge in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install libpdal-plugin-icebridge using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install libpdal-plugin-icebridge

The installation of libpdal-plugin-icebridge might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install libpdal-plugin-icebridge Using apt-get

To install libpdal-plugin-icebridge using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install libpdal-plugin-icebridge.

sudo apt-get -y install libpdal-plugin-icebridge

Install libpdal-plugin-icebridge Using Synaptic

To install libpdal-plugin-icebridge using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install libpdal-plugin-icebridge on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for libpdal-plugin-icebridge. This will display the libpdal-plugin-icebridge package in the package window, now to install libpdal-plugin-icebridge, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the libpdal-plugin-icebridge package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of libpdal-plugin-icebridge.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install libpdal-plugin-icebridge Using aptitude

To install libpdal-plugin-icebridge on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of libpdal-plugin-icebridge.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install libpdal-plugin-icebridge using the command aptitude install libpdal-plugin-icebridge.

sudo aptitude -y install libpdal-plugin-icebridge

How to Upgrade libpdal-plugin-icebridge on debian

If you want to upgrade the libpdal-plugin-icebridge package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade libpdal-plugin-icebridge using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade libpdal-plugin-icebridge to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade libpdal-plugin-icebridge.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade libpdal-plugin-icebridge sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade libpdal-plugin-icebridge

Upgrade libpdal-plugin-icebridge using Aptitude

To upgrade libpdal-plugin-icebridge using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade libpdal-plugin-icebridge.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade libpdal-plugin-icebridge

Upgrade libpdal-plugin-icebridge using Synaptic

To upgrade libpdal-plugin-icebridge using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for libpdal-plugin-icebridge, now right-click libpdal-plugin-icebridge, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade libpdal-plugin-icebridge just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall libpdal-plugin-icebridge on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall libpdal-plugin-icebridge from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just libpdal-plugin-icebridge, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove libpdal-plugin-icebridge

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of libpdal-plugin-icebridge

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of libpdal-plugin-icebridge you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge libpdal-plugin-icebridge

Remove libpdal-plugin-icebridge using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall libpdal-plugin-icebridge using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for libpdal-plugin-icebridge, right-click the libpdal-plugin-icebridge package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall libpdal-plugin-icebridge click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install libpdal-plugin-icebridge on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade libpdal-plugin-icebridge using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of libpdal-plugin-icebridge then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
